title: Sample preparation and imaging for large scale 3D spectral confocal imaging of tissues

protocol.title: Sample preparation and imaging for large scale 3D spectral confocal imaging of tissues
protocol.title_html: Sample preparation and imaging for large scale 3D spectral confocal imaging of tissues

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Mount sample on uncharged slide in PBS using prepositioned piece of spacer tape to support coverslip.

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Gently push coverslip to the sample and seal with rubber cement dispensed from a syringe and 16 G needle.

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Configure the microscope for multiphoton excitation at 910 nm for detecting SHG and auto-fluorescence (AF) (Table 2).

source.specifications: Custom motorized stage coupled to a femtosecond pulsing MaiTai DeepSee laser (Spectra Physics, Santa Clara, CA) with EOM modulation for multiphoton excitation and a solid state laser launch providing 405 nm, 488 nm, 552 nm and 635 nm excitation. Imaging is performed with 25x 0.95 NA or 20x 0.75 NA Mimm objective with water immersion for label-free imaging or Leica immersion oil RI=1.51 with a 20x 0.75 NA Mimm objective for spectral confocal imaging. Detectors on the SP8 include two HyD detectors and two photo-multiplier tube (PMT) detectors ordered by wavelength, HyD1, PMT2, HyD3, PMT4. The SP8 is controlled by and linear unmixing is performed in Leica LASX software v. 3.5.2 build 18963.
source.name: SP8 confocal scan-head mounted upright DM6000 microscope

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Configure emission path by opening confocal pinhole and adjust the bandpasses on 2 to 4 detectors to collect SHG (~455 nm) and AF as desired (refer to “Excitation and filter settings”). Use PMTs to avoid detector “overloading” and data loss.

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Configure x, y and z limits to cover the entire tissue. Scan in x and y at 0.5-1 µm/pixel. Sample in z with 1-2 um steps.

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Perform scans with standard galvanometers set to 400 Hz, and averaging by line 2x.

source.title: Label Free Imaging of Tissue

source.description: Fluorescence lifetime imaging is under development and may be included at this step.

source.title: Staining of Tissue with Fluorescent Small Modules and by Immunofluoresence

source.description: Recover specimen by removing rubber cement and gently lifting coverslip.

source.body: Lifting the coverslip may be easier if done after or while soaking the slide in PBS.

source.description: Washing: Sample is washed 1x in PBS >

source.description:
Blocking: Remove wash and block non-specific binding sites with PBSTS 4–8 hours at
on rocking platform.

source.description:
Indirect primary antibody staining (Table 1): Incubate tissue in
staining solution for all the indirect detection primary antibodies 8-16 hours at
on rocking platform.

source.title: Staining of Tissue with Fluorescent Small Modules and by Immunofluoresence

source.description: Mount tissue with Prolong Glass or Fluoromount on pre-cleaned sides with silicone grease as needed to support coverslip.

source.title: Staining of Tissue with Fluorescent Small Modules and by Immunofluoresence

source.description: Seal cover slip to slide with rubber cement applied with a syringe.

source.title: Large-scale 3D Spectral Confocal Imaging

source.description: Configure the microscope for spectral confocal imaging as described in Table 2 below.

source.body: The settings for laser power, detector, voltage, gain and offset may vary based on the microscope configuration.

source.title: Large-scale 3D Spectral Confocal Imaging

source.description:
Configure x, y and z limits to cover the entire tissue. Scan in x and y at 0.5-1 µm/pixel. Sample in z with
steps.

source.title: Large-scale 3D Spectral Confocal Imaging

source.description: Perform scans with standard galvanometers set to 400 Hz. The multispectral 16 channels are configured as indicated in Table 2 with 4 sequences of 4 detectors.

source.title: Preparation of Bead Slide for Reference Spectra

source.description:
Incubate
of CML latex beads (ThermoFisher, cat# C37253) with
of fluorophore conjugated secondary overnight.

source.body: Reference spectra for DAPI and Oregon Green are collected from tissue labeled only with DAPI or Oregon Green. The remaining reference spectra from fluorophores outlined in Table 1 are collected from single-fluorophore labeled latex beads.

source.title: Preparation of Bead Slide for Reference Spectra

source.description:
Wash the beads after centrifuging at
. Repeat twice. Dilute and mix individually labeled beads in MM (Prolong Glass or Fluoromount) such that 5-10 beads of each individually labeled beads is visible in a field size of 500 x 500 µm.

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Scan slide-mounted beads labeled with known fluorophores with settings given in the table below for channels 1-16.

source.body: Data collected is subjected to linear unmixing with Leica LASX software

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Process” -> “Dye Separation” -> “Channel Dye Separation”

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select regions of interest including beads intensity and select “Add” to add to spectra.

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select Rescale to “Per Channel.”

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Load” to load a saved matrix. The saved matrix will be displayed near the bottom of the window.

source.title: Genearating Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Apply”.

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: In the LASX software select image to unmix.

source.body: Once a matrix file is generated (.sdm) it may be used again to apply collected images.

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Process” -> “Dye Separation” -> “Automatic Dye Separation”

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Set fluorescent dyes to “8.”

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Set Rescale to “Per Channel.”

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Load” to load a saved matrix. The saved matrix will be displayed near the bottom of the window.

source.title: Applying Unmixing Matrix for Linear Unmixing

source.description: Select “Apply”.

source.title: Stitiching/Merging of Unmixed Confocal Volumes

source.description: Select images to merge.

source.body: Following unmixing, the confocal dataset is merged with LEICA LASX software.

source.title: Stitiching/Merging of Unmixed Confocal Volumes

source.description: Select “Process” -> “Mosaic Merge”

source.title: Stitiching/Merging of Unmixed Confocal Volumes

source.description: Check “Autostitching”, “Smooth” overlap and “Linear Blending”.

source.title: Stitiching/Merging of Unmixed Confocal Volumes

source.description: Select “Apply”.

source.title: Cytometric analysis of stitched and merged unmixed confocal volumes

source.description: All 3D cytometry is performed with the ImageJ plugin Volumetric Tissue Exploration and Analysis (VTEA). The settings for processing, segmentation and gating are given in analysis files. As software improves, new versions of VTEA may be used.

materials.name: 24 or 48 flat well bottom culture dishes

description:
Frozen participant samples are first sized and preserved for high-resolution 3D imaging. Preserved biopsy sections are imaged, without staining, to understand the sample’s structure and condition.Next, the biopsy sections are stained with antibodies and fluorescent dyes to identify specific structures and cells with pathological significance.This stained sample is imaged in its entirety giving a 3D image.Finally, the 3D image is analyzed by experts to assess known and novel pathologies.
This protocol summarizes both label-free imaging and labeling for fluorescence imaging including the labeling, mounting and imaging approaches.The fluorescent labels used herein include conjugated or fluorescent small molecules and conjugated antibodies.Protocol 2 uses both directly conjugated primary antibodies for identifying specific antigens and indirect labeling with a fluorophore conjugated secondary antibody that recognizes the primary antibody.
Multiple rounds of imaging are enabled by the use of a non-hardening mounting media, low charge slides and removable rubber cement as a sealant.Details are described below.
Two imaging approaches are outlined: protocol 1 and 2.Protocol 1 involves label free imaging of auto-fluorescent species and second harmonic generation (SHG) with multiphoton excitation.These modalities are followed by protocol 2, which involves staining with fluorescent small molecules and immuno-fluorescence and subsequent large scale 3D confocal fluorescence imaging.There are three different staining strategies used in protocols, summarized in Table 1.
These protocols start with fixed 50 µm tissue sections prepared as described in the Cryopreservation protocol.
